subject: Swimming
lead_paragraph: Alain Bernard of France broke the world record in the 100-meter freestyle at the European Championships in Eindhoven, the Netherlands, beating the mark he set Friday. Bernard clocked 47.50 seconds to beat his previous mark, 47.60.
snippet: Alain Bernard of France broke the world record in the 100-meter freestyle at the European Championships in Eindhoven, the Netherlands, beating the mark he set Friday. Bernard clocked 47.50 seconds to beat his previous mark, 47.60.
